abstract: Goldman bested its rivals on the Facebook deal by combining different strands of its business to serve an important client.
snippet: Goldman bested its rivals on the Facebook deal by combining different strands of its business to serve an important client.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs’s rivals must be kicking themselves. The firm’s nearly $2 billion investment connection with Facebook is relatively small financially, but it’s big in franchise terms. After the lumps Goldman took last year, the deal showed the firm could still wrap its tentacles around an important client for mutual benefit.

headline.main: Goldman’s Calculated Risk Won Facebook Deal

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Ian Campbell
